chapter.title: Functions
chapter.para: Most function names in the Rexx Mathematical Functions package are similar to the names of their corresponding mathematical functions. Note that in ooRexx 4.0.0 and later, the MathLoadFuncs() and MathDropFuncs() are nops.

listitem.para: MathLoadFuncs()
MathDropFuncs()
RxCalcSqrt()
RxCalcExp()
RxCalcLog()
RxCalcLog10()
RxCalcSinH()
RxCalcCosH()
RxCalcTanH()
RxCalcPower()
RxCalcSin()
RxCalcCos()
RxCalcTan()
RxCalcCotan()
RxCalcPi()
RxCalcArcSin()
RxCalcArcCos()
RxCalcArcTan()

section.title: MathLoadFuncs()
section.para:
Beginning with ooRexx 4.0.0 this function is basically a nop. Use:
::requires 'rxmath' LIBRARY
to gain access to the functions in the package.
However, if this function is called with a single, string, parameter, the copyright information is printed.

section.title: MathDropFuncs()
section.para: This function is a nop in ooRexx 4.0.0 and later. It does nothing.

section.title: RxCalcSqrt()
section.para: Returns the absolute value of the square root of number.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The number whose square root you wish to calculate.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.

section.title: RxCalcExp()
section.para: Returns the exponential function of number.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The number for which you wish to calculate the exponential function.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.

section.title: RxCalcLog()
section.para: Returns the natural logarithm (base e) of number.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The number for which you wish to calculate the natural logarithm.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.

section.title: RxCalcLog10()
section.para: Returns the base 10 logarithm of number.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The number for which you wish to calculate the base 10 logarithm.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.

section.title: RxCalcSinH()
section.para: Returns the hyperbolic sine of number.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The number for which you wish to calculate the hyperbolic sine.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.

section.title: RxCalcCosH()
section.para: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of number.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The number for which you wish to calculate the hyperbolic cosine.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.

section.title: RxCalcTanH()
section.para: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of number.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The number for which you wish to calculate the hyperbolic tangent.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.

section.title: RxCalcPower()

indexterm.primary: raise a number to a power
number to a power, raise a

section.para: Returns the value of mathematical expression number1 raised to the power of exponent number2.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The mathematical expression to be raised to the power of exponent number2.
The exponent to which number1 is to be raised.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.

section.title: RxCalcSin()
section.para: Returns the sine value for number, where number is the angle size, expressed in degree [D], radian [R], or grade [G] units.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The angle size, expressed in degree [D], radian [R], or grade [G] units.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.
Indicates that the angle size is expressed in degrees. This is the default.
Indicates that the angle size is expressed in radians.
Indicates that the angle size is expressed in grades.

section.title: RxCalcCos()
section.para: Returns the cosine value for number, where number is the angle size, expressed in degree [D], radian [R], or grade [G] units.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The angle size, expressed in degree [D], radian [R], or grade [G] units.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.
Indicates that the angle size is expressed in degrees. This is the default.
Indicates that the angle size is expressed in radians.
Indicates that the angle size is expressed in grades.

section.title: RxCalcTan()
section.para: Returns the tangent value for number, where number is the angle size, expressed in degree [D], radian [R], or grade [G] units.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The angle size, expressed in degree [D], radian [R], or grade [G] units.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.
Indicates that the angle size is expressed in degrees. This is the default.
Indicates that the angle size is expressed in radians.
Indicates that the angle size is expressed in grades.

section.title: RxCalcCotan()
section.para: Returns the cotangent value for number, where number is the angle size, expressed in degree [D], radian [R], or grade [G] units.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The angle size, expressed in degree [D], radian [R], or grade [G] units.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.
Indicates that the angle size is expressed in degrees. This is the default.
Indicates that the angle size is expressed in radians.
Indicates that the angle size is expressed in grades.

section.title: RxCalcPi()
section.para: Returns the value of pi.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.

section.title: RxCalcArcSin()
section.para: Returns the arcsine of number, where the result can be expressed in degree [D], radian [R], or grade [G] units.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The number for which the arcsine is to be calculated.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.
Indicates that the result is expressed in degrees. This is the default.
Indicates that the result is expressed in radians.
Indicates that the result is expressed in grades.

section.title: RxCalcArcCos()
section.para: Returns the arccosine of number, where the result can be expressed in degree [D], radian [R], or grade [G] units.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The number for which the arccosine is to be calculated.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.
Indicates that the result is expressed in degrees. This is the default.
Indicates that the result is expressed in radians.
Indicates that the result is expressed in grades.

section.title: RxCalcArcTan()
section.para: Returns the arctangent of number, where the result can be expressed in degree [D], radian [R], or grade [G] units.
Parameters:

listitem.para: The number for which the arctangent is to be calculated.
The precision of the calculation. If a value is not specified, the precision of the calling Rexx activity is used. Precision is limited to 16 digits.
Indicates that the result is expressed in degrees. This is the default.
Indicates that the result is expressed in radians.
Indicates that the result is expressed in grades.
